awd_titl_txt: CAREER: Efficient Detection of Pipeline Hazards in          Superscalar Architectures
awd_abstract_narration: In this project, a fast simulation environment to aid code  generation for pipelined and superscalar machine will be  developed. The project  will develop a specification language  capable of describing superscalar  architectures, and extend  current mechanisms to permit the detection of data  and control  hazards, and heuristics for efficient scheduling of instructions  on modern superscalar machines. The architectural specifications  will be  compiled into fast table-driven automata that accurately  simulates values  moving through pipelines, thus providing  adequate information to compilers to  correctly predict (and  avoid) structural, data and control hazards that  adversely affect  the performance of the code generated.    As a part of the  education goals, the PI will develop a compiler  laboratory that will emphasize  not only the fundamentals of  compiler design, but also the importance of the  resource  utilization to program performance.  Interactive tools for  learning  and better understanding of automatic parsing mechanisms  will be developed and  adopted for teaching undergraduate level  compiler techniques.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
